sentences.en: A single specimen testing record is sufficient to evaluate.
sentences.cn: 单试件试验结果对计算是足够用的.

sentences.en: Don't evaluate a person on the basis of appearance.
Don't evaluate people by their clothes.
sentences.cn: 不要根据衣着来评价人.

sentences.en: It can be difficult to evaluate the effectiveness of different treatments.
sentences.cn: 要对各种治疗方法的效果作出评估会很难。
让我们评定一下此证据的价值.

sentences.en: Managers are required to evaluate all proposals by the same competent techniques.
sentences.cn: 要求管理人员用同一的法定方法去评价所有的建议.

sentences.en: That enables communications engineers to evaluate precisely telephone, radio and TV circuits.
sentences.cn: 那使通信工程师有可能对电话 、 收音机和电视机电路作出精确的估计.

sentences.en: The law now requires that parents serve on the committees that plan and evaluate school programs.
sentences.cn: 现在，法律要求家长在规划和评估学校项目的委员会中任职。

sentences.en: The market situation is difficult to evaluate.
The school has only been open for six months, so it's hard to evaluate its success.
sentences.cn: 该学校仅开办了六个月, 现在还很难估计它的成就.

sentences.en: They had no idea how to evaluate from a financial perspective what management was doing.
sentences.cn: 这些人根本不知道如何从财务角度来评价当前的管理工作.

sentences.en: They will first send in trained nurses to evaluate the needs of the individual situation.
sentences.cn: 他们首先会派一些训练有素的护士来评估每个病人的需求。

sentences.en: They're doing tests to evaluate the effectiveness of this herb as an antiseptic.
sentences.cn: 他们正在检测这种草药作为杀菌剂的有效性.

sentences.en: To be clear , usability testing is , at its core, a means to evaluate, not to create.
sentences.cn: 请记住, 可用性测试的核心是评估, 并非创造.

sentences.en: We need to evaluate the success of the campaign.
sentences.cn: 我们要评估一下这次运动是否成功。

sentences.en: We often sat down to evaluate the changing situation.
sentences.cn: 我们常坐下来判断状况之变化.

sentences.en: You can use the same technique when you evaluate your child's work at home.
sentences.cn: 当你评价孩子在家中的工作时,也可使用同样的技巧.

sentences.en: You should be able to evaluate your own work.
sentences.cn: 你应该能够评估自己的工作。

words.tran_cn: 评价；[审计] 评估；估价；求值

trans.tran_en: to judge how good, useful, or successful something is

trans.tran_cn: 评估， 评价； 估值， 估价； 定价
trans.tran_en: to judge how good, useful, or successful something is
to judge how good, useful, or successful something is
